page.title: 01A PICTURE OF WATCHET
page.content: Watchet is a small busy port on the {Bristol Channel.}The town lies between the Quantocks and the Brendons and has roads leading to{Taunton, Bridgwater and{Minehead}and a steam railway (for the tourists) to go to{Minehead}or {Taunton.}Watchet has a busy little harbour for small pleasure boats and large ships that visit 2 or 3 times a week. There are two large factories, the{Paper Mill}which makes paper and {Protective Papers}who print on papers, these factories also need two large lorry companies. As Watchet is near the sea many people come on holiday therefore tourists are important.The old streets around the harbour have lots of small shops,banks,pubs and there is a large{Recreation Ground where people play football and cricket there are swings as well.Over 3,000 people live here.
